semantic_title: Hypertension with Heart Disease Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Chapter 9: Diseases of the Circulatory System > a. Hypertension > 1) Hypertension with Heart Disease

content.full_text: Hypertension with heart conditions classified to I50.-, Heart failure, I51.4, Myocarditis, unspecified, I51.89, Other ill-defined heart diseases, and I51.9, Heart disease, unspecified, is assigned to a code from category I11, Hypertensive heart disease. Use additional code(s) from category I50, Heart failure, or I51, Complications and ill-defined descriptions of heart disease, to identify the heart condition. Hypertension with heart conditions classified to I51.5, Myocardial degeneration, or I51.7, Cardiomegaly, is assigned to a code from category I11, Hypertensive heart disease. No additional code is assigned to identify the specific heart condition. The same heart conditions (I50.-, I51.4-I51.7, I51.89, I51.9) with hypertension are coded separately if the provider has documented they are unrelated to the hypertension. The applicable hypertension code I10, Essential (primary) hypertension, or a code from category I15, Secondary hypertension, should be assigned. Sequence according to the circumstances of the admission/encounter. (Evidence: pg no: 50, L45-L54)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding hypertension with various heart conditions, specifying when to use combination codes from I11 category versus separate coding, and requirements for additional codes (Evidence: pg no: 50, L45-L54)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use I11 category for hypertension with I50.-, I51.4, I51.89, I51.9 heart conditions, plus additional codes to identify specific heart condition (Evidence: pg no: 50, L45-L49)
detailed_rules.explanation: When hypertension occurs with heart failure, unspecified myocarditis, other ill-defined heart diseases, or unspecified heart disease, assign a code from I11 category and use additional codes from I50 or I51 to specify the heart condition (Evidence: pg no: 50, L45-L49)
detailed_rules.applies_to: I50.-, I51.4, I51.89, I51.9 with hypertension
common_applications: Hypertensive heart disease with heart failure
Hypertensive heart disease with ill-defined heart conditions

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use I11 category for hypertension with I51.5 or I51.7 heart conditions, no additional code needed (Evidence: pg no: 50, L50-L51)
detailed_rules.explanation: When hypertension occurs with myocardial degeneration or cardiomegaly, assign a code from I11 category but do not assign additional codes to identify the specific heart condition (Evidence: pg no: 50, L50-L51)
common_applications: Hypertensive heart disease with myocardial degeneration

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code heart conditions separately from hypertension when provider documents they are unrelated (Evidence: pg no: 50, L51-L52)
detailed_rules.explanation: When the provider specifically documents that heart conditions are unrelated to hypertension, code the conditions separately using appropriate hypertension codes (I10 or I15) and heart condition codes (Evidence: pg no: 50, L51-L54)
detailed_rules.applies_to: All heart conditions when documented as unrelated to hypertension
common_applications: Concurrent but unrelated hypertension and heart disease
Heart conditions with different etiology than hypertension

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify hypertension and concurrent heart condition
Step 2: Check if provider documents conditions as unrelated
Step 3: If unrelated, code separately with I10 or I15 plus heart condition code
Step 4: If related, determine specific heart condition type
Step 5: For I50.-, I51.4, I51.89, I51.9: use I11 plus additional codes
Step 6: For I51.5, I51.7: use I11 only, no additional codes
Step 7: Sequence according to admission/encounter circumstances
